item.title: Peer Review: SensorOverlord Paper
item.description: Overview and purpose I would like to keep a record of my submission history and peer review results for each of my first-author papers and grants. I’ve heard that the peer review process can be really disheartening for many people, and that it often involves many, many rounds of rejection. I also appreciate reading peer reviews, and think that they can be helpful to read after reading a published paper.

item.title: SSD Formatting and Install in Ubuntu 19.04
item.description: Today I upgraded the base 256 GB SSD (2.5 mm) on my Thinkpad T460 to a 1 TB Samsung 860 EVO. It took me a few google searches to learn how to make the transition. In the end, I used Tuxboot to make a bootable Clonezilla USB drive, and then GParted to resize my partition. Here’s what I did step-by-step: Connect your new SSD via USB. I used a StarTech cable from Amazon.

item.title: Connecting a remote MongoDB database with R/Shiny
item.description: While making a Shiny App for a lab project (Sensor Overlord), I wanted to create a feature where users could input sensor data into a database, where it could be accessible to other users. I decided to give MongoDB a shot, mostly becuase of the free hosting services available on MongoDB’s website. And it was actually extremely straightforward. There are great resources available online, like the mongolite user manual and the shiny persistent data storage page.
